item.title: AWS Batch
item.description: Related Notes AWS Wiki Batch AWS Batch is aimed at the specific use case of executing batch jobs that are pulled from a queue.

item.title: AWS Lambda
item.description: Related Notes AWS Wiki Lambda AWS Lambda lets you run code without provisioning or managing servers. You pay only for the compute time you consume.

item.title: AWS Step Functions
item.description: Related Notes AWS Wiki Lambda AWS SWF Helpful Links AWS Step Functions Pricing Step Functions AWS Step Functions provides serverless orchestration for modern applications.

item.title: Simple Notification Service
item.description: Related Notes AWS Wiki Simple Notification Service (SNS) SNS is a fully managed pub/sub messaging service. With Amazon SNS, you can use topics to simultaneously distribute messages to multiple subscribing endpoints such as Amazon SQS queues, AWS Lambda functions, HTTP endpoints, email addresses, and mobile devices (SMS, Push) Messages in an SQS queue will continue to exist even after the EC2 instance has processed it, until you delete that message.

item.title: Simple Queue Service
item.description: Related Notes AWS Wiki Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) Amazon SQS is a message queue service used by distributed applications to exchange messages through a polling model.
